Anecdota oxoniensia. Mediaeval and modern series,

"John Bale's autograph notebook, preserved among Selden's manuscripts in the Bodleian library ... A carefully planned catalogue ... difering from Bale's published Catalogues [Illustrium maioris Britanniae scriptorum summarium [1548] and Scriptorum illustrium maioris Brytannie Catalogus 1557-1559] ... First, it is arranged alphabetically, not chronologically. Secondly, by far the greater number of the articles are followed by a reference to the authority or source from which their matter is derived ... This notebook ... bears no title ... I have adopted the title Index Britanniae scriptorum."--Pref.

List of some works cited.--Index Britanniae scriptorum.--Appendix: I. Scriptores anonymi. II. Libri anonymi. III. Chronica. IV. Collectanea. V. Ex bibliothecis. VI. De collegio Martonensi viri eruditi.--Cognomina auctorum.--Tituli operum.--Fontes.--Addenda et corrigenda.

Companion to: Composing a life / Mary Catherine Bateson. New York : Atlantic Monthly Press, c1989.

An inspiring exploration of a new stage of the life cycle-- "Adulthood II," created by unprecedented levels of health, energy, time, and resources-- of which we have barely begun to be fully conscious.

Thinking about longevity -- Small and beautiful -- Liberation time -- From strength to strength -- Acts and chapters -- Focusing multiplicity -- Pleasure and responsibility -- A time for wholeness -- What we pass on -- Shaping the future -- Knowledge old and new.

"Thinking Race argues that racism results from a misguided blending of biological facts with pernicious socially constructed ideas. This book aims to help readers accept the reality of human difference while understanding human unity"--
